alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 9:15AM EDT until July 16 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Hartford County in northern Connecticut... * Until 1000 AM EDT. * At 915 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Plainville, or near Farmington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Newington, Windsor, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Berlin, Avon, Plainville, Suffield, Ellington and Windsor Locks. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for northern Connecticut. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for northern Connecticut.
